data.title: Tickets and Tours — Woodrow Wilson
data.meta_description: Embark on a journey through history, guided by knowledgeable experts who will bring Woodrow Wilson's story to life. Don't miss this opportunity to better understand one of America's most consequential leaders. Join us for an enriching adventure filled with historical significance and unforgettable m
data.text:
Adults - $20

Seniors (65 and up) and Active Military - $18

Youth (ages 6-17) - $12

Child (5 and under) - FREE

Active College Student w/ valid ID - $12

(Please note that tickets may be purchased in the President’s Gift Shop. Online ticket ordering is currently unavailable.)

BEST VALUE: Become a member and enjoy 12 months of free museum admission, exclusive programs (in-person and online), exclusive access to our members-only video library, membership in the Time Travelers Network program, and savings throughout the year! Click here for more information.

Tickets include a self-guided tour of the museum, including the interactive World

War I Trench exhibit, and the Pierce-Arrow limousine, and a guided tour of the Manse/birthplace. Tickets are available on a first-come, first-served basis and are likely to sell out early, especially on weekends, so please arrive 15 minutes before your preferred tour time.

After a guided tour of Woodrow Wilson's birthplace, guests will have the opportunity to meet with a member of the curatorial or archives staff to see documents and artifacts in our collection that are rarely on display. This private tour also includes a self-guided museum tour.

The admission fee for this private experience is $200 and covers one group of up to four guests. An additional charge of $50 per person will be added to groups over four. Most tours run approximately three hours, including the self-guided portion of the tour. Sorry, but no discounts or special offers may be applied to this particular tour.

Behind-the-scenes tours are available by reservation only and should be booked at least one week in advance. Tours are offered Mondays, Tuesdays, Thursdays and Fridays. If you are interested in reserving a date and time, please email us at presidentshop@woodrowwilson.org or call 540-885-0897 ext. 102.

Join a special guided tour focusing on the experiences of the enslaved people who lived and labored in the Presbyterian Manse where Woodrow Wilson was born.

Admission is $25 per person. Your ticket also includes a self-guided tour of the museum, which includes the WWI trench exhibit and the Pierce-Arrow limousine. Sorry, but no discounts or special offers may be applied to this particular tour.

These tours are offered on Tuesdays and Thursdays at 1:30 PM. Tickets may be purchased in our gift shop upon arrival. Please plan to arrive at least 10 minutes early if you wish to take this tour.
